items.title: Douglas Crockford on 'retiring' JavaScript
items.content:
#â€‹600 â€” July 29, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Roll Your Own JavaScript Runtime â€” Bun, Rhino, Deno, Node, and now Blueboat.. is creating your own JavaScript runtime environment the new â€œhello worldâ€? ğŸ˜† Not quite, but this is a fun walk through the bare basics of the process, and youâ€™ll have a Rust, Tokio and V8 powered system of your own by the end ofÂ it.

Bartek IwaÅ„czuk

Bun: A Complete Overhaul of the JavaScript Ecosystem? â€” Continuing on the JavaScript runtime theme, Forrest takes a thoughtful look at Bun, its promises, and potential. While itâ€™s â€œstill not quite ready for the workplace,â€ he concludes there are clearly good timesÂ ahead.

Forrest Allison

Add Professional Scheduling Components to Your Web App â€” Save development time with Bryntum's web component suite. The UI library includes fully customizable Gantt, scheduler, calendar, data grid and Kanban board widgets. Integrate with React, Vue, Angular or vanilla js. Download a free 45-dayÂ trial.

Bryntum sponsor

Douglas Crockford: "The best thing we can do today to JavaScript is to retire it." â€” Ouch! An interview with the author of JavaScript: The Good Parts and sort-of-inventor of JSON where he explains the benefits of code reading, why we need better languages, and how he wonâ€™t â€œwrite about JavaScriptÂ again.â€ What about TypeScriptÂ then?Â ğŸ˜

Evrone

15 Common Beginner JavaScript Mistakes â€” James puts out a lot of fantastic JavaScript videos on his YouTube channel, but I asked him to write an article instead because I knew more people would read it ;-) And he did!

James Quick

IN BRIEF:

  • Wikimedia wikis (including Wikipedia) now play their videos with Video.js â€“ here's the full story.

  • The TC39er podcast is back after a few months' rest with â–¶ï¸ an interview with Luca Casonato of the Deno core team â€“ they discuss Deno, TC39, and favorite language proposals.

  • âš›ï¸ Max Rozen has collected together examples of larger production-grade open source React apps to dig into and learn from.

  • GitHub has rolled out more npm security enhancements with improvements to login and publishing, the ability to connect GitHub and Twitter accounts to npm, and a new npm audit signatures command for verifying package integrity.

  • ğŸ–¼ A sneak peek at how Storybook 7.0 is going to look.

RELEASES:

Impress.js 2.0 â€“ JS + CSS3 powered presentation framework.
Lerna 5.3 â€“ Manage and publish multiple packages from a monorepo.
Ghost 5.5 â€“ Node.js CMS / publishing platform.
Mongoose 6.5 â€“ Node.js MongoDB object modeling.
NodeBB 2.3 â€“ Node.js based forum software.
Jasmine 4.3 â€“ Popular JS testing framework.
Node.js 18.7.0

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Everything You Need to Know About Import Maps â€” Import maps provide a way to control the behavior of JavaScript imports so even something as simple as import moment from "moment" on a Web page could pull in the right code. Theyâ€™re beginning to be used in more places despite a lack of official Firefox or Safari support yet (though polyfills areÂ available).

Ayooluwa Isaiah

Misko Hevery on Why Qwik Will Improve JavaScript Frameworks â€” Angularâ€™s original creator Misko Hevery says his new project answers a long-standing problem: Qwik is a JavaScript framework that promises â€˜instantâ€™ apps. I watched his introductory presentation the other day and it wasÂ convincing.

Starr Campbell (The New Stack)

Stytch Is Building Your All-In-One Platform for User Authentication

Stytch sponsor

ğŸª„ Â Extract Parameter Types from String Literal Types with TypeScript â€” If the things that TypeScriptâ€™s type system can do impress or confuse you, this well presented article will give you a turbocharged dose ofÂ either..!

Tan Li Hau

Deeper Testing of Bun's Performance and Compatibility Against Node â€” We recently linked to Davidâ€™s initial Node vs Bun comparison but had to issue a correction due to a flaw in the methodology. Luckily, David is now revisiting the idea with â€œsome more carefully constructed performance testsâ€.

David Herron

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Creating ESM-Based Shell Scripts for Unix and Windows with Node.js â€” Dr. Axel has figured out all the tricks involved and boiled it down into a tightÂ post.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Writing a Fuzzy Search Component with Preact and Fuse for Astro
Lloyd Atkinson

'Notes From My Journey From Rust to... TypeScript??' â€” It's not all one way traffic.
Glauber Costa

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Blueboat: An All-in-One Serverless JavaScript Runtime â€” If youâ€™ve used Cloudflare Workers, the idea will seem familiar. It ties together V8, process level snapshots and Rust to focus on running JavaScript in multi-tenant style safely andÂ quickly.

Heyang Zhou

Skeleton: A Full Featured Svelte UI Component Library â€” Svelte + Tailwind makes a skeleton very happy. Lots of docs and demosÂ here.

Brain and Bones, LLC

Stream Is The #1 Chat API for Custom Messaging Apps â€” Streamâ€™s Chat API & SDKs enable teams to add fully-featured in-app messaging in days - apply for your Maker Account, free for qualifyingÂ teams.

Stream sponsor

simplex-noise.js 4.0: A Fast Simplex Noise Implementation â€” Small, self contained, and fast, and you can use it in cool demos like this or for applying convincing grain/noise to images or other data, say.

Jonas Wagner

AST Explorer: Analyze the Structure of Parsed JavaScript Online â€” A neat little Web-based tool to see how supplied JavaScript code gets parsed into a syntaxÂ tree.

Felix Kling

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

Article Parser 7.0 â€“ Extract article content from a given URL in Node.
React Simple Maps 3.0 â€“ Beautiful SVG maps for React apps.
Emoji Mart 5.2 â€“ Emoji picking component.
hls.js 1.2 â€“ JS lib to play HTTP Live Streaming content.
MicroDiff 1.3 â€“ Zero dependency object and array comparison library.
Temporal JavaScript SDK 1.0 â€“ Durable code execution framework & platform.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineers â€” Sticker Mule is the Internet's most "kick ass" brand. Our software team operates from 17 countries, and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker mule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

â“ Did you know..

  • ğŸ‘´ğŸ» When JavaScript Weekly started in November 2010 â€“ 600 issues ago now â€“ Barack Obama was serving his first term, the iPad was less then a year old, and Express had just beenÂ released. I wonder what will be going on when issue 1000Â arrives..

items.title: Common JavaScript issues developers face
items.content:
#â€‹599 â€” July 22, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

RedwoodJS vs. Blitz.js: The Future of Fullstack Meta-Frameworks â€” Quite a lengthy review of both frameworks. Redwood is an opinionated React-based framework oriented heavily round the idea of a GraphQL server as the â€˜one APIâ€™ at the heart of an app. Blitz, on the other hand, is a Ruby on Rails-inspired layer on top of Next.js with SPA, server side rendering and static site generationÂ chops. Don't forget Remix too.. this is a busyÂ space!

Tamas Kadlecsik

Ten Common JavaScript Issues Developers Face â€” If youâ€™ve been working with JavaScript for many years (perhaps since 2014 when this newly-updated article was first penned), these are potholes you (probably) already know how to steer around, but thereâ€™s plenty to chew on hereÂ otherwise.

Ryan J. Peterson

CSS Animations and Transitions â€” Join David Khourshid on this detailed video course and discover how to bring your interfaces to life with UI animations. Learn about CSS transitions, keyframes, custom properties, choreography, animation states, and muchÂ more

Frontend Masters sponsor

Reducing the Size of a Large JavaScript SDK Package by 29% â€” After some comments on how large their JavaScript package was getting, developers at Sentry (an app monitoring service) set to work trying to get an initial 30% reduction. Tree shaking turned out to have the biggestÂ effect.

Abhijeet Prasad (Sentry)

Payload 1.0: A Headless CMS Platform Built on Node â€” An exciting project that appeared in early 2021 with a bang then became open source just a couple of months ago. Thereâ€™s a lot to like about Payload if you need a headless CMS including a customizable React-based admin system, GraphQL or REST APIs, flexible auth and file upload systems, and itâ€™s easy to get started. GitHubÂ repo.

Payload CMS

IN BRIEF:

  • UPDATE / ERROR: Last week we linked to a comparison of Bun and Node.js's performance but, as is often the case with benchmarks, there was a flaw: Node.js was being run in both cases! ğŸ˜¬ We await further results. Thanks to Craig Doremus for letting us know.

  • Hemanth HM presents a quick update from the 91st TC39 meeting where several language proposals wereÂ advanced.

  • Hermes is a JS engine built by Facebook primarily for use in React Native and, curiously, it was possible to misuse its quicksort implementation to run the classic FPS DOOM â€“ a bug resulting in a $12k bounty payout.

  • ğŸ“Š A data-driven attempt to compare the popularity of React, Angular, Angular.js, Vue and Svelte. Spoiler: React sits on top.

RELEASES:

NeutralinoJS 4.7.0 â€“ Lightweight cross platform apps with JS & HTML.
npm-check 6.0 â€“ Check for outdated or unused dependencies.
Fastify 4.3 â€“ Fast Node.js web framework.
ESLint 8.20
Angular 14.1
Vue 2.7.8
.. and more releases at end of this issue.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Thoughts on Integer Math in JavaScript â€” No concrete examples here but if fast integer math is something you need, you could do worse than to build upon Jamesâ€™ thinking (to which he hopes to write a more completeÂ follow-up).

James Darpinian

JavaScript Obfuscation Techniques by Example â€” The Hacker News discussion around this article was, perhaps, even more interesting, IÂ thought.

Trickster Dev

10 npm Security Best Practices

Snyk.io sponsor

JavaScript AST Manipulation with Babel: The First Steps â€” From the same author as the item on obfuscation (above) comes a look at the basics of using Babel to turn obfuscated code into a syntax tree and then back into more readableÂ JavaScript.

Trickster Dev

â–¶Â Â An Introduction to SvelteKit in 80 Minutes â€” Svelte is an increasingly popular way to build reactive frontend apps and SvelteKit provides a framework and more complete development experience around Svelte. Nacho gives us aÂ tour.

Nacho Falk

â–¶Â Â Blazingly Fast 'React' with Fresh â€” One of the most popular React YouTubers out there heads Deno-side to look at Fresh, a new islands-based web framework that doesnâ€™t use React per se but.. close enough, with Preact and JSX for rendering andÂ templating.

Jack Herrington

2022 State of the Java Ecosystem Report â€” New Relicâ€™s report is based on data gathered from millions of applications providing performanceÂ data.

New Relic sponsor

Converting Cypress E2E Specs from JavaScript to TypeScript â€” More to it than you mightÂ expect.
Gleb Bahmutov

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Tweakpane 3.1: Compact UI Element for Tweaking Parameters and Viewing ValueÂ Changes â€” This is the sort of thing you see in creative coding demos quite often, but could be used almost anywhere. You can create your own mini pane of basic UI controls to dynamically adjust (or just reflect) values relating to something going on on the page. Itâ€™s simple and looks great, and if you want a demo, thenâ€¦

cocopon

Fireworks.js 2.0: It's Literally Fireworks for Your Web Page â€” Well, literally in a visual sense at least ;-) The homepage is a neat demo given you can dynamically play around with all of the libraryâ€™s parameters (courtesy of Tweakpane, mentioned above!)

Vitalij Ryndin

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, now with support forÂ Vitest.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Superstate: A New 'Micro' State Management Library â€” So micro, even, that the getting started tutorial takes all of 30 seconds to read. GitHubÂ repo.

Guilherme Oderdenge

TanStack Table v8: Headless UI for Building Tables and Datagrids â€” Want the hard work of managing a table or data grid element taken care of but want to keep 100% control over markup and styles? This is what you need (if the idea of a â€˜headless UIâ€™ is new to you, read this intro). Vanilla JS, React, Vue, Solid and Svelte developers are all taken careÂ of.

Tanner Linsley

Atropos: Create Touch-Friendly 3D Parallax Hover Effects â€” Use with plain JS, React, or Vue and itâ€™s easy to configure with no dependencies. The home page includes some quite striking examples that arenâ€™t as over the top as youâ€™dÂ expect.

Vladimir Kharlampidi

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

PrimeNG 14 â€“ Suite of 80+ Angular UI components.
Acorn 8.8 â€“ Tiny JS parser written in pure JS.
Discord.ts 10.0 â€“ Framework to create a Discord chat bot.
Prisma 4.1 â€“ Popular ORM for Node.js and TypeScript.
MelonJS 13.0 â€“ 2D sprite-based JS game engine.
Secure Electron Template 20.0 â€“ An Electron boilerplate app.
zip.js 2.6.2 â€“ Zip and unzip files in the browser or Deno.
Octokit.js 2.0.4 â€“ GitHub SDK for browsers, Node, and Deno.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineers â€” Sticker Mule is the Internet's most "kick ass" brand. Our software team operates from 17 countries, and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker mule

Attend Our July 27th 2022 State of Wage Inequality in Tech Discussion â€” Join Hired, Blacks in Technology, Adaâ€™s List, Interview Kickstart, and Speak_ for a collaborative panel discussion about Hiredâ€™s 2022 Impact of Wage Inequality dataÂ report.
Hired

â“ Did you know..

  • ... there's a fully open source online MIDI editor called Signal? Quite fun to compose with (or, in my case, just scribble notesÂ over).
  • ... Smashing Magazine has done a roundup of image compression and optimization tools? Mostly online, but some local ones too.
  • ... there's a Web site that satirizes the modern Web browsing experience? Amazing and dispiriting in equal measure.
  • ... ğŸŒ† you can create a miniature 3D 'city' of your GitHub contributions?
  • ... we have ğŸ’Œ a Node.js newsletter too?

Attend Our July 27th 2022 State of Wage Inequality in Tech Discussion â€” Join Hired, Blacks in Technology, Adaâ€™s List, Interview Kickstart, and Speak_ for a collaborative panel discussion about Hiredâ€™s 2022 Impact of Wage Inequality dataÂ report.
  
Hired 
  










â“ Did you know..
... there's a fully open source online MIDI editor called Signal? Quite fun to compose with (or, in my case, just scribble notesÂ over).
... Smashing Magazine has done a roundup of image compression and optimization tools? Mostly online, but some local ones too.
... there's a Web site that satirizes the modern Web browsing experience? Amazing and dispiriting in equal measure.
... ğŸŒ† you can create a miniature 3D 'city' of your GitHub contributions?
... we have ğŸ’Œ a Node.js newsletter too?

items.title: Vite 3, or in French: quick, quick, quick.
items.content:
#â€‹598 â€” July 15, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Vite 3.0 Released â€” I follow a lot of JavaScript communities and developers and Vite, a frontend development and build tool of the same provenance as Vue.js, seems to be unanimously held in high regard and is used by projects as diverse as Nuxt, SvelteKit, Astro, and even PHPâ€™sÂ Laravel. Related:

  • Why Replit switched from webpack to Vite.
  • â–¶ï¸ Vite explained in 100 seconds by Fireship.
  • â–¶ï¸ A 13 minute introduction to Vite by Evan You himself.
  • Ladle - Vite-backed React component dev tool, and Storybook alternative.
  • Fastify DX â€“ in-development full stack framework on top of Fastify &Â Vite.

Evan You and Contributors

CKEditor 5 Is Here to Make Collaborative WritingÂ Easy â€” A customizable rich text editor that allows you to build collaboration within your application in hours. Ready-to-use features like comments, track changes, real-time collaboration, version history and many more. Start your free trial to implement itÂ now.

CKEditor 5 sponsor

Rety: Live Coding Without the Stress â€” Last week we mentioned Lea Verouâ€™s â–¶ï¸ CSS variables talk â€“ a talk that had some â€˜live codingâ€™ sections which were orchestrated in advance using Rety, which Lea has released to usÂ all.

Lea Verou

Node-RED 3.0 Released â€” Node-RED is a popular Node.js-based low/no-code programming environment heavily used in the IoT space (though not exclusively). v3.0 requires Node 14+ and includes numerous UI/DXÂ enhancements. Well worth a try if the idea of visually joining together logical components appeals toÂ you.

Nick O'Leary

IN BRIEF:

  • It's early days for Bun (featured last week) but there's already an awesome-bun list of curated resources for it.

  • ğŸ“† EmberFest, a European Ember.js conference, is taking place in Paris this September 22â€“23.

  • Mark Erikson shares some useful pointers on how to research the level of npm package use.

  • We only mentioned Vue 2.7 a few weeks ago, but â–¶ï¸ is Vue 2 dead?, asks Erik Hanchett who brings us up to speed with what's going on Vue-side.

RELEASES:

Ember 4.5 â€“ The productive, battle-tested framework.
Preact 10.10 â€“ Fast 3KB React alternative.
pkg 5.8 â€“ Package a Node app into an executable.
React Big Calendar 1.4 â€“ Google Calendar-esque component.
AdminJS 6.0 â€“ Node.js admin panel system.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Statements vs. Expressions â€” If you were put on the spot and asked to describe the difference between a statement and an expression in JavaScript, would you have a good answer? If youâ€™re not entirely sure, this is a good refresher on whatâ€™sÂ involved.

Josh W Comeau

Testing Bun's Speed and Compatibility with Node.js â€” David decided to put Bun through its paces to see how it would fare with a real world app vs Node.js. Unsurprisingly for an app with real world pressures (file system, network, et al.) the difference in performance was minor, but he was impressed at how seamlessly itÂ worked.

David Herron

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut â€” The best issue tracking software is one that software developers are actually happy toÂ use.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Applying SOLID Principles in React â€” The so-called SOLID object oriented design principles have stood the test of timeâ€”they were first introduced by Robert Martin in 2000. Although much has changed since, they are still valid and can be valuable when applied in ReactÂ apps.

Konstantin Lebedev

Getting Started with Vue Composables â€” For when you want to extract stateful functionality to reuse acrossÂ components.

Abiola Farounbi

â–¶Â Â An Introduction to Functional Programming in JS â€” A light hearted, yet useful, introduction to the â€˜mustachioed hipster of programming paradigms.â€™ Perfect forÂ beginners.

Cassidy Williams

Build Your Work Portfolio with Other JavaScript Engineers onÂ Polywork

Polywork sponsor

â–¶Â Â 'I Made a Role-Playing Game in Excel' â€” Weâ€™ve mentioned this guyâ€™s experiments in creating JavaScript games that use PowerPoint and Word in the past â€“ heâ€™s back and now using a spreadsheet for hisÂ canvas.

SethEric

Working with File System Paths on Node.js
Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Understanding The Performance Impact of Anti-flicker Snippets
Andy Davies

Build Your Own Wordle for Numbers
Olivia Gibson

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Add to Calendar Button: Add a Quick Way to Let Users 'Add toÂ Calendar' â€” The button is pre-styled and it drops down to show options for various calendars â€“ Apple, GCal, iCal, Microsoft 365,Â Outlook..

Jens Kuerschner

Luxon 3.0: Library for Working with Dates and Times â€” If youâ€™re familiar with something like Moment.js, itâ€™s like that but with immutable objects, 1-indexed months, Intl-powered localization (so no locale or timezone files needed!) andÂ more.

Moment.js

Integrate eSignatures in Your App in Less Than a Week â€” Enable document signing from anywhere with HelloSign's eSignature functionality. Test the API forÂ free.

HelloSign, a Dropbox Company sponsor

NestJS v9 Released â€” Nest is a TypeScript-based server-side framework for when you need a more fleshed out and complete platform to work on (or get support from) than straight Express, say. v9 introduces a handy REPL, a configurable module builder, durable providers, andÂ more.

Kamil Mysliwiec

Link Preview JS: Get Information about a Link's Target Page â€” Uses the OpenGraph metadata that folks like Facebook and Twitter use when showing linkÂ previews.

Oscar Franco

QUICK RELEASES:

Commander.js 9.4 â€“ Node.js CLI app library.
eruda 2.5 â€“ Web console for mobile browsers.
Tedious 15.0 â€“ TDS module for connecting to SQL Server.
mux.js 6.2 â€“ Utilities for inspecting video container formats.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ¤” DID YOU KNOW..

  • .. you can code â–¶ï¸ Tetris for the Web using React from Rust, rather thanÂ JavaScript?

  • .. you can hold the Shift key when looking at network requests in Chrome's devtools to see what initiated the request and its dependencies?

  • .. FizzBuzz is FizzBuzz years old?

  • .. you can easily 'test drive' over 100 programming-focused fonts at programmingfonts.org?

  • .. if you're a frontend developer, we also have ğŸ’Œ Frontend Focus, a newsletter focused entirely on frontend, browser, and Web design related news, tech, and tools. Here's the latest issue.

items.title: An all-in-Bun JavaScript runtime.
items.content:
#â€‹597 â€” July 8, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Bun: An Exciting, Speedy New JavaScript Runtime â€” Tired of Node? Tired of Deno? A new challenger has appeared. Bun is a new runtime aimed at 'outside of browser' use cases and is built, intriguingly, around WebKit's JavaScriptCore, rather than V8. Some notable features:

  • Includes its own bundler, transpiler, and task runner.
  • Boasts huge performance improvements.
  • Supports a lot of Node and Web APIs already.
  • You can use npm packages in it.
  • Works on macOS (x86 and Arm), Linux, or WSL.
â–¶ï¸ This 20-minute video does a reasonable job of showing it off, or if you'd prefer â–¶ï¸ a three-minute summary from Fireship. It's early days but this is an exciting project to watch. (Iâ€™ve heard Bun is called â–¶ï¸Â BarmÂ Cake in northernÂ England..)

Jarred Sumner

FlexGrid by Wijmo: The Industry-Leading JavaScript Datagrid â€” We are excited to announce some great new features in our powerful JavaScript datagrid component for your web applications. Add familiar Excel-like functionality to make the most of your tabular data. Get started with FlexGrid for freeÂ today.

Wijmo from GrapeCity sponsor

bundlejs: Online npm Package Bundler and Size Checker â€” An online tool that can treeshake, bundle, minify, and compress (gzip and brotli) projects and show you just what their weight is. Bundlephobia is another popular option in this space, but Mark Erikson says bundlejs is â€œnow _wayyy_Â better.â€

Okiki Ojo

How To NOT Block the Browser: The Essentials â€” If youâ€™ve seen articles or tools talking about taking code off of the â€˜main threadâ€™ and wondered why that matters, this is the primer for you. It covers the event loop, Web Workers, async scheduling, and how they make aÂ difference.

Matthew Costello

IN BRIEF:

  • The latest update to VS Code is out. You can now easily toggle sourcemaps on and off, use Step Into Target in the JS debugger, and there's a 3-way merge editor.

  • Talking of VS Code, Microsoft is beginning to unveil (in 'private preview' for now) the VS Code Server that backs VS Code's remote development features so you can run it on your own hardware.

  • The folks at MDN are discussing modernizing their code examples to modern JavaScript standards.

  • Shopify is now officially a member of Ecma and Surma will be a TC39 delegate.. so expect to see JS module blocks soonÂ ğŸ˜†

RELEASES:

Node 14.20.0 (LTS), 16.16.0 (LTS) & 18.5.0 (Current)
Fuite 1.6 â€“ Tool for finding memory leaks in web apps.
oclif 3.1 â€“ Node.js open CLI framework.
Notion SDK for JS 2.0 â€“ Official Notion JavaScript client.
Tabulator 5.3 â€“ Interactive table and data grid control.
Preact 10.9 â€“ Say hello to React 18's new hooks (except useId).
Perspective 1.5.1 â€“ Fast data visualization via WebAssembly.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Chess Engines: A Zero to One â€” This is a fun introduction to something I didnâ€™t think would be particularly interesting. chessboard.js and chess.js make it easy to getÂ experimenting.

Will DePue

The New Wave of React State Management â€” It's not a quick piece by any means, but provides a sweeping overview, along with some history and opinion, of the world of state management and some availableÂ options.

Frontend Mastery

Wallaby.js: 15x Faster JavaScript Testing, Now with Support forÂ Vitest â€” Wallaby runs tests as you type, with real-time runtime values, errors and coverage displayed next to yourÂ code.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Reimagining Front-End Web Development with htmx andÂ Hyperscript â€” Itâ€™s interesting to see how developers have options to not write JavaScript, yet still produce usefulÂ frontends. â–¶ï¸ Writing JavaScript to Avoid Writing JavaScript is also a neat talk on htmx and this broadÂ phenomenon.

Owen Jones

â–¶Â Â 'How I Built a Software Agency Website with Next.js and Tailwind' â€” If you want to see how another developer works in the most peaceful and elegant way possible, this (quite long) video is for you.Â Lovely.

Takuya Matsuyama

Simplify Your Full-Stack Applications with XState â€” State management is one of those things it can take a while to really get into, particularly in areas of development not commonly associated with them, but it can be worth it in order to reduce systemic complexity (at the cost of more codeÂ up-front).

Daniel Belo GonÃ§alves

How to Build, Test and Deploy a Bookstore App with React 18, Vite, and Netlify Functions â€” Brings together a variety of modern tools to practical ends, including getting an app online with serverless functions on theÂ backend.

Yevhen Kapelianovych

GV (Google Ventures) Invests $35M Into JavaScript NotificationsÂ API â€” A need for notification management systems has grown rapidly as software companies realize this critical userÂ experience.

Courier.com sponsor

â–¶Â Â Easy Form Validation in Vue 3 with Vuelidate â€” Vuelidate is, unsurprisingly, a validationÂ library.

John Komarnicki

Dr. Axel Goes Deep on Executing Shell Commands from Node
Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

How to Use the Native Web Share API from JavaScript
Daily Dev Tips

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Big Calendar 1.x: A GCal/Outlook-like Calendar React Component â€” Uses flexbox for improvedÂ responsiveness.

Jason Quense

PocketBase: A Go-Powered Backend in One Binary â€” An interesting project that could replace Firebase in numerous scenarios. Itâ€™s written in Go but ultimately acts as the backend to your frontend JavaScript app. It uses SQLite and you get an admin dashboard built-in with file and user management too. Live demo and rather niceÂ docs.

Gani Georgiev

ProtoScript: Protocol Buffers Runtime and Code Generation Tool â€” The runtime is a lot smaller than Googleâ€™s, and the code generator generates idiomatic JavaScript complete with JSON (de)serializers and TSDocÂ comments.

Tate Thurston

Free Activity Feeds & Chat APIs for Qualifying Teams

Stream sponsor

Deprank: Use PageRank to Find the Important Files in Your Codebase â€” PageRank is an algorithm commonly associated with how Google used to rank Web pages, but the idea can be adapted to ranking things in any sort of network, as seenÂ here.

Codemix Ltd

tsParticles: Particles, Confetti and Fireworks for Your Pages â€” Create customizable particle related effects for use on the Web. Uses the regular 2D canvas for broadÂ support.

Matteo Bruni

Amplify UI for React Now Generally Available â€” Amplify is AWSâ€™s offering intended to attract frontend and mobile development projects to their infrastructure. A significant part of that is Amplify UI, a collection of React components connected directly to the AWSÂ cloud.

Amazon Web Services, Inc.

Wayne: It's Like Express.js, But Inside Service Workers â€” Specifically, itâ€™s a routing library for use within serviceÂ workers.

Jakub T. Jankiewicz

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineers â€” Sticker Mule is the Internet's most "kick ass" brand. Our software team operates from 17 countries, and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker mule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ¤” DID YOU KNOW..

  • you can now use AWS's IAM role/access management system outside ofÂ AWS?

  • it's possible to have â–¶ï¸ a Sudoku puzzle without any digits on it that takes two hours to solve?

  • Lea Verou gave a â–¶ï¸ fantastic talk about CSS custom properties at CSS Day 2022? You will learn something.

  • ğŸ˜ we have a Postgres newsletter too? A lot is going on in the Postgres space lately, so if you use it, check it out.
